title: Orion (Wiki)
summary: The main project page for the Orion general knowledge encyclopedia.

title: United States
summary: A country primarily located in North America, comprising 50 states, a federal district, and several territories.

title: Amerigo Vespucci
summary: Italian explorer and cartographer whose name was given to the American continents.

title: Washington, D.C.
summary: The capital city and federal district of the United States.

title: New York City
summary: The most populous city in the United States and a global financial center.

title: North America
summary: A continent in the Northern Hemisphere and almost entirely within the Western Hemisphere.

title: Martin Waldseem√ºller
summary: German cartographer known for the 1507 map that first used the name America.

title: Spanish People
summary: An ethnic group and nation native to Spain, who colonized parts of the Americas.

title: Florida
summary: A state in the Southeastern region of the United States.

title: French People
summary: An ethnic group and nation native to France, significant in early American colonization.

title: Mississippi River
summary: The second-longest river and chief river of the second-largest drainage system on the North American continent.

title: East Coast (USA)
summary: The coastline along which the Eastern United States meets the North Atlantic Ocean.

title: English People
summary: An ethnic group and nation native to England, who established the Thirteen Colonies.

title: Thirteen Colonies
summary: A group of British colonies on the Atlantic coast of North America that declared independence in 1776.

title: Great Britain
summary: An island situated off the north-western coast of continental Europe.

title: American Revolutionary War
summary: An armed conflict between Great Britain and thirteen of its North American colonies.

title: Constitution of the United States
summary: The supreme law of the United States of America.

title: Louisiana Purchase
summary: The acquisition of the territory of Louisiana by the United States from France in 1803.

title: American Civil War
summary: A civil war in the United States between the Union and the Confederacy.

title: Union (American Civil War)
summary: The term used to refer to the United States of America during the American Civil War.

title: Confederate States of America
summary: An unrecognized breakaway republic in the Southern United States during the Civil War.

title: Transcontinental Railroad
summary: A contiguous railroad line constructed between 1863 and 1869 across the western United States.

title: World War I
summary: A global conflict originating in Europe that lasted from 1914 to 1918.

title: Roaring Twenties
summary: A period of economic prosperity and cultural edge in the 1920s.

title: Great Depression
summary: A severe worldwide economic depression that took place mostly during the 1930s.

title: World War II
summary: A global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945.

title: Pearl Harbor
summary: A surprise military strike by the Imperial Japanese Navy Air Service upon the United States.

title: Cold War
summary: A period of geopolitical tension between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Soviet Union
summary: A socialist state that spanned much of Eurasia from 1922 to 1991.

title: Space Race
summary: A 20th-century competition between two Cold War rivals, the Soviet Union and the United States, to achieve firsts in spaceflight capability.

title: Apollo 11
summary: The spaceflight that first landed humans on the Moon.

title: Moon
summary: Earth's only natural satellite.

title: Civil Rights Movement
summary: A political movement and campaign from 1954 to 1968 in the United States to abolish institutional racial segregation.

title: September 11 Attacks
summary: Four coordinated terrorist attacks against the United States by al-Qaeda.

title: War on Terror
summary: An international military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks.

title: Canada
summary: A country in North America, sitting to the north of the United States.

title: Mexico
summary: A country in the southern portion of North America.

title: Rocky Mountains
summary: A major mountain range in western North America.

title: Hawaii
summary: A state of the United States located in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Alaska
summary: A U.S. state on the northwest extremity of North America.

title: Silicon Valley
summary: A region in Northern California that serves as a global center for high technology and innovation.
